intro: Biscutella lamarckii, commonly known as the mountain thimble, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces small, elongated pods that contain seeds. Biscutella lamarckii is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cool, mountainous climates.
